section.label: Section VIII.
section.title: GCU Gun Control Logic A1 SLEP.

para0.title: Introduction.
para0.para: The following paragraphs provide information on the Theory of Operation for the GCU Gun Control Logic A1 SLEP. Part information is also provided in paragraph 3-8.2 Part Information.

subpara1.title: Theory Of Operation.
subpara1.para: The GCU extends the functions performed by the CDA and specifically deals with logic molding associated with the main gun. In performing these functions, the GCU interfaces the PDA, CDA, and the hand controls. Control signals for the main gun are sent from the hand control on the CDA to the GCU, where control logic circuits are used to develop the control signals which are then relayed to the main gun. These control signals provide timing control for the various rates of fire and to select AP or HE ammunition. Status signals are then sent back to the GCU to assure safe operation. These signals indicate a misfire, bolt position, and which ammo is selected (AP or HE). Status signals are then sent back to the CDA, where they are used to light the MAIN GUN STATUS indicators.

subpara2.title: GCU Gun Control Logic A1 SLEP Equipment Description.
subpara2.para: The GCU Gun Control Logic A1 SLEP (P/N 00004A2206-1) herein referred to as the UUT, is a Circuit Card Assembly (CCA) containing the discrete logic chips used for timing and control of the main weapon system.
